key_points: Vice President-elect Kamala Harris criticized President Donald Trump for a phone call urging Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger to overturn election results.
Harris described the call as a 'bald-faced, bold abuse of power' during a drive-thru rally in Savannah, Georgia.
The recorded conversation between Trump and Raffensperger was obtained by CNN and reported by the Washington Post.
Senior adviser to President-elect Joe Biden, Bob Bauer, called the call a 'disgraceful story about Donald Trump’s assault on American democracy.'
Harris highlighted the failed attempts by Trump and other Republicans to overturn the election results on baseless voter fraud allegations.
Harris emphasized Georgia's role in electing Biden and herself, criticizing the opposition's questioning of the electoral process.
Trump's January 2 audio call with Raffensperger, along with White House chief of staff Mark Meadows and several lawyers, was leaked and reported.
Harris condemned Trump's claims that the January 5 Senate runoff elections were 'illegal and invalid'.
Harris, addressing future representation, expressed concern over the absence of a Black woman in the Senate after her resignation.
Senate candidate Jon Ossoff accused Trump of attempting to disenfranchise Black voters and criticized Sens. Perdue and Loeffler for not defending Georgia voters.
spokespersons: Bob Bauer (Senior Adviser to President-elect Joe Biden)
